page.title: 04The Village Policeman
page.content: PC.Ireland polices Cuxton and Halling villages. Most villages are policed from the nearest town. After checking his vehicle PC.Ireland drives to collect teleprinter messages from Rochester Station and fits freshly charged batteries into his radio. The radio is the only link with the station during the day. On returning to Cuxton he does a foot patrol and then deals with messages. Poachers, rubbish dumped illegally and suspicious cars are often reported. The cars owners are traced via the police computer. Often PC.Ireland is called away to help with large police operations. Another part of his job is to visit schools to give talks on road safety and warn children about the dangers of going with strangers. Vandalism and burglary are Cuxton's most common crimes.
